test.name: Inscrire un user dans la BD

kw.name: Connect To Database Using Custom Params
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using the map string `db_custom_param_string`.
kw.msg: Executing : Connect To Database Using Custom Params : pymysql.connect(db_api_2.connect(database='demo', user='root', password='', host='localhost'))

kw.name: Row Count Is 0
kw.arg: select id from users where username = '${USERNAME}' and password = md5('${PASSWORD}')
kw.doc: Check if any rows are returned from the submitted `selectStatement`. If there are, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is 0 | select id from users where username = 'Tryy' and password = md5('Try!2001')
Executing : Row Count | select id from users where username = 'Tryy' and password = md5('Try!2001')

kw.name: Inscription user par une requete Http POST
Create Session
kw.doc: Create Session: create a HTTP session to a server
kw.msg: Creating Session using : alias=session1, url=http://localhost/demo/api/user, headers={}, cookies={}, auth=None, timeout=None, proxies=None, verify=False, debug=0

kw.name: Create Dictionary
kw.doc: Creates and returns a dictionary based on the given ``items``.
kw.msg: ${data} = {'username': 'Tryy', 'password': 'Try!2001'}

kw.name: Create Dictionary
kw.doc: Creates and returns a dictionary based on the given ``items``.
kw.msg: ${headers} = {'Content-Type': 'application/x-vvv-form-urlenooded'}

kw.name: POST On Session
kw.doc: Sends a POST request on a previously created HTTP Session.
kw.msg: POST Request : url=http://localhost/demo/api/user/signup.php path_url=/demo/api/user/signup.php headers={'User-Agent': 'python-requests/2.27.1', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Accept': '*/*', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Content-Length': '33', 'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'} body=username=Tryy&password=Try%212001
${response} = <Response [200]>

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.
kw.msg: ${json} = {'status': True, 'message': 'Successfully Signup!', 'id': '46', 'username': 'Tryy'}

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.
kw.msg: {'status': True, 'message': 'Successfully Signup!', 'id': '46', 'username': 'Tryy'}

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Strings
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to strings.
kw.msg: Argument types are: <class 'int'> <type 'unicode'>

kw.name: Verifier que l'utilisateur es ajouÃ© dans la bd
Connect To Database Using Custom Params
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using the map string `db_custom_param_string`.
kw.msg: Executing : Connect To Database Using Custom Params : pymysql.connect(db_api_2.connect(database='demo', user='root', password='', host='localhost'))

kw.name: Row Count Is Equal To X
kw.arg: select id from users where username = '${USERNAME}' and password = md5('${PASSWORD}')
kw.doc: Check if the number of rows returned from `selectStatement` is equal to the value submitted. If not, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is Equal To X | select id from users where username = 'Tryy' and password = md5('Try!2001') | 1
Executing : Row Count | select id from users where username = 'Tryy' and password = md5('Try!2001')

kw.name: Execute Sql String
kw.arg: DELETE FROM users WHERE username = '${USERNAME}' and password = md5('${PASSWORD}')
kw.doc: Executes the sqlString as SQL commands. Useful to pass arguments to your sql. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Execute SQL String | DELETE FROM users WHERE username = 'Tryy' and password = md5('Try!2001')
